column5: Hi Fellow members,  Can you tell me how to get to Oshawa Pier parking spot and can I try Sheephead or silver bass there ?  Thanks in advance!

Simcoe Street all the way down to the lake, park right there at the beach area and walk out on the pier.  In the years I was down there never tried fishing off it or anywhere else in lake O for that matter..more of a small lake kinda guy

I'm sure both species are there but have never seen one caught, more carp, small mouth & pike. The old marina is a good place, drift in a boat or if you look hard enough there are ways to get in there but by land you would/could be trespassing , however saying that I haven't seen a person get booted out of there in years. I heard arguments from locals saying it's not private property anymore but if you do enter know there is a chance it could be.
Thanks so much for the information. I don't have a boat and mainly shore fishing.  Thanks again!
Do I need to bring a long net just in case I hook a fish? Never been there and don't know how high the Pier is.  Thanks again!
It's high you'll need a long handled net.
